statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -9 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 15 \\ 9 \\ 12 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -9 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 15 \\ 9 \\ 12 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right].
